ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Neethi Vedhi is a human right organization which supports the empowerment process and right conscientization of marginalized groups especially Tribals, women and children. Organizing awareness sessions on human rights and beneficial legislations for the above mentioned groups is a major activity of Neethi Vedhi. We also provide free legal aid to the victims of attrocities and violations. We conduct court cases to support the victims. Issues affecting public at large are taken up and we attempt to file Public Interest Litigations.We also provide counselling to those who are emotionally distressed. From 2008 onwards, Neethi Vedhi is working as the Service Provider recognized by the Kerala Social Welfare Board under the provisions of Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act. We also bring out leaflets and hand books on laws and human rights for the marginalized groups.We try to foster the culture, language and art forms of tribals.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The major activities of Neyyattinkara Integral Development Societyare carried out through six sectors according to the need of the people and the area. The six sectors are: 1. Socio economic 2. Agriculture 3. Health 4. Women and child 5. Labour Justice and Peace 6. Dalits, Tribals and Backward community Our interventions in these six sectors are given below. 1. Socio Economic Development Programmes Family support programme Housing Programme Renovation of Houses Employment generation programmes Income Generation programmes Vocational Training Programmes Skill promotion training programme Awareness generation programmes Formation of SHGâ€™s Formation of VDCâ€™s Micro Credit Credit Unions Educational Scholarship 2. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Nilambur Muslim Orphanage born in 1969 with eight inmates has now grown into a great cause. Nearly 700 children have successfully passed out from this institution. At present the orphanage has 207 inmates, with 102 boys and 105 girls. They consist of orphans and destitutes, studying in different levels from pre-primary to Post Graduation. The Orphanage launched a College of Arabic Studies (1995) as part of its Silver Jubilee Celebrations, and the first batch of Afdul-ul Ulama (final) course passed out last year. Besides religious studies and regular academic lessons, Vocational training is also imparted to the students. At Amal School (Established in 2000) the learning process is seen as one that is both challenging and enjoyable. We believe education should foster creativity, independent thinking, exploration and experimentation as a life long process. Amal College of Advanced Studies (Established in 2005) is run by the Nilambur Muslim Orphanage Committee to impart quality Higher Education to the people of backward and rural areas, especially to the orphans, destitutes and Backward Communities. â€˜Jan Shikshan Sansthan â€“Malappuramâ€™ (Institute of Peopleâ€™s Education) Sponsored by Ministry of Human Resource Development & Department of School Education & Literacy allotted to the orphanage for developing rural and backward classes employment. The Orphanage Committee has plans to launch a few more ventures, aimed at preparing the children to face the tough challenges of changing times.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Quilon Social Service Society (QSSS) is the official organization of the Catholic Diocese of Quilon for social apostolate with the Bishop himself serving as President. Founded in the year 1960, the major endeavors of the diocesan organization during the yester years have been in providing basic existence in support to the ethnic fisher communities and similar other backward sections together with their transition to more human conditions. In this regard, the Society has been instrumental in launching and conducting series of projects and programs, namely, Non formal education, Animation, Community organization, Micro finance development / Peoples bank, Skills up-gradation, Occupational development, Womenâ€™s empowerment, Innovative income generation schemes, Community health, housing, sanitation etc. For the last couple of years, the entire organizational capacity has remained devoted contracting with the disastrous outcome of Tsunami by taking up various measures / projects of rehabilitation â€“ restoration/ reconstruction, Disaster resistant housing, occupational reinstatement, health care, Social security measures â€“ insurance, Community based disaster preparedness integrated with natural resource management, etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Palliative Care OP and Home Care Financial assistance is provided for- Travelling expenses to poor patients Who are under palliative care. The poor patients coming for the OP service are given travel allowance at the Rate of Rs.100 per Patient for every Visits. This is done to ensure that the continuous medication of the patients is not interrupted. Annadhaanam - is conducted as part of Out Patient service which happens on every Tuesday. The purpose is to bring â€˜WEâ€™ feeling among Patients, Volunteers and Staffmembers. All the Patients, their Family members, Volunteers and Staff members are served One Time Meals for free. Financial Assistance to Orphaned senior citizens.Financial Assistance to mentally retarded. Educational assistant to the children of poor patients and deceased patients.Financial Assistance to bed-ridden patients.Regular medical camps at various places. Awareness seminars & camps. Training to palliative care volunteers. Rehabilitation to patients and their Families. Team consisting of expert doctors, nurse, social workers and volunteers carry out daily house visits to treat the bed-ridden patients. The poor patients coming for the op are given travel allowance. This is done to ensure that the continuous medication of the patients is not interrupted. The patient requires a healthy diet along with the medicines. Hence monetary helps is also extended to patients from the under privileged strata. Student dependent on patients from poor economic background are given boom, stationary and monthly stipend. Monthly stipend extended to very old patients who cannot afford treatment from their own resources. Travel allowance provided to the patients of the palliative care OP for availing treatment facilities of Regional Cancer Centre(RCC), Sree Chitra Thirunal Institute for Medical Science & Technology, Govt. Medical college, and General hospital, Thiruvananthapuram. Monetary assistance to under privileged patients who have to spend large sums on medicines and lab tests. Monthly stipend to parents of those suffering from mental/physical deformities. Lab sample of bed-ridden patients collected from their residence if required. Nursing services like dressing and injection available to those in dire need. Rehabilitation assistance. In case of death of earning member, assistance is provided for the rehabilitation of the family as well as the education of the children Monthly medical camps, cancer detection camps and awareness campaigns are also organized with view of enhancing the physical and mental health of the society Eye check up camps organized and spectacles distributed free of cost to extreme poor sections. * Periodically seminars are organized in educational institutions with the assistance of experts, to develop sense of cleanliness, self -reliance, confidence, compassion and voluntariness amongst children. These programs also intend to lay stress on the importance of life style management in the contemporary society. The foundation also join hands with the like minded Organizations to create a collective

Raksha imparts training for children through Pre-School, Raksha Special School and Vocational Skill Training Centre. The teaching in the school is supported by Departments of Physiotherapy, Langauage and Communication and Behaviour Support Unit. All the programmes are non-residential. The organization also runs related projects in the field of rehabilitation through Diploma in Special Education-Cerebral Palsy, Awareness generation, Identification, Survey, Research and Services to Support Inclusive Education. We are registered under the Persons with Disability Act, National Trust Act and Rehabilitation Council of India.

ngoList.title: RANGAPRABHATH
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Rangaprabhath Childrens Theatre perhaps the first Childrens Theatre in India which has completed 40 years of active and creative service in developing a highly satisfactory support system of educational strategies to the formal schooling system has been in the forefront of organizing appropriate programs involving children teachers and parents The experiment which began under the general guidance and support of the doyen of the Malayalam Theatre Prof G Sankara Pillai was ably sustained with necessary zeal and dedication by its founder president Sri K Kochunarayana Pillai himself a distinguished teacher actor and artist of great repute In recognition of the experience of Rangaprabhath in the field of education and innovative approaches to Childrens education reputed organization such as the IGNCA CCRT Gandhi Smriti and Darsan Samiti Sangeeth Natak Akademi and the Department of Culture and National Balbhavan NewDelhi etc Recognized the Rangaprabhath as a Resource and Training Centre The Rangaprabhath during its 40 years of work for Childrenâ€™s holistic development through performing arts has won several awards and recognition from the state and National Academies departments Government and specialized agencies which promote art education and culture The conferment of Rama Chandran Ikeda Award to Rangaprabhath in 1999 is a great recognition of the significant role played by Rangaprabhath in Childrens education through performing arts particularly Childrens Drama and awareness creation both in surrounding community and in the Schools in Trivandrum and elsewhere in the state Rangaprabhath also got very prestigious International GDBirla award for the year 2005 introduced by the Birla Academi of Art and Culture for preserving the Indian Cultural and Spiritual Heritage The senior fellowship from Government of India was awarded to Kochunarayana Pillai the president of Rangaprabhath Since the recognition of National Balbhavan the activities related to children are monitored and encouraged under the guidance of the National Balbhavan New Delhi The aim and scope of the work consist of a comprehensive and composite approach to inculcate in socially economically backward children habits attitudes and values and offer a serious of opportunities to involve themselves creatively in any or more of the following activities which the organizers are hopeful of using them as a useful educational tools and aids Childrens Plays Folk Arts Dance Music and Instrumental Music Theatre Games Story Telling Creative Dramatics Puppetry Choral Music Painting Drawing Book Binding and Making

ngoList.title: REHAB FOUNDATION
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Rehab foundation is a registered voluntary organization under Indian societiesRegistration Act xx1 of 1860 No 10116/91 dated 4th December 1991 as a registered charitable society with an objective of moral educational and vocational upliftment of the poor handicapped persons in the society.For the attainment of these goals,the foundation has maintaining special school namely Good Hope School for the Mentally Handicapped.The foundation has completed its 18th year of service In the year 2009 with a proud welfare activities for the handicapped. During the year under report the foundation has made a commendable progress in the area of education and rehabilitation service to those who need special care and attention.The foundation has organized Identification camps at various panchayaths and municipalities in the district,to find out the disabled pupils and make necessary steps to rehabilitate them.Awareness classess in the form of seminars symposium etc. Which are aimed at the parents of the disabled children. Survey also conducted to reach out the children from their environment. The special schools for the Mentally Handicapped,started functioning in the year 1991.It was humble beginning with 3 mentally retarded children. At present at the school provides educational service at 4 stages viz,pre-primary,primary,secondary and vocational level at the school and admit, the children under age group of 5to18 years.At persent there are 60 children studying at school Amoungthem 25 children are hostel inmates. The school curriculum emphasized on functional Academic, developing self help skills,pre-vocational skill and co-curricular activities such as vocal music, dance,art,sports and games etc are included in the course of studies. From the last three years Rehab Foundation is the District Local Level Commettee member of National Trust at Malappuram.
